title: A third of Christchurch quake claims still outstanding
text:
A third of Christchurch quake claims still outstanding 
Monday 10 Aug 2015 11:15 a.m. 
Despite a ramp-up in settlements, a third of Christchurch earthquake insurance claims have yet to be settled nearly five years after the first event. 
In the quarter to the end of June, private insurers settled a record 1500 Canterbury earthquake claims, about 40 per cent up from last quarter and more than double some quarters in 2013, according to the Insurance Council of New Zealand. 
That means about 16,000, or two-thirds, of all claims have now been settled, totalling about $15 billion in payments made by insurers. 
But another $4.7 billion is still to be finalised. 
Currently, 2311 homes are also under construction - meaning they can't be counted as settled - while about another 4700 are waiting for construction to begin or cash settlements to be paid out. 
Insurance Council chief executive Tim Grafton said despite negative media coverage, the industry was picking up the pace. 
"Contrary to recent commentary reported in the media about the rate of recovery, we are continuing to see more residential settlements than ever," he said. 
However, 488 people still have yet to receive any offer from their private insurer, with 358 still yet to make a decision on their offer. 
But the Insurance Council said the vast majority of these were recent transfers from the EQC to private insurers - of which there were 327 last quarter. 
Claims of over $100,000 are split between EQC and private insurers, meaning if they end up moving over that cap, they get moved to onto private insurer's books. 
THE BREAKDOWN: 
* a total 24,527 claims to private insurers 
* about 16,000 of those have been settled 
* total value of all claims expected to be $19.65 billion 
* $15 billion has been settled 
* 488 people have yet to be made an offer by their insurer 
* about 12,000 settlements have been in cash 
* 1500 settlements June quarter - up from 1150 last year, and 756 in 2013 
* Claims deemed settled if payment received or building work finished 
NZN
